intro.title: Welcome to the Umrah Journey
intro.description: Umrah is a journey to Baytullah (House of Allah) in Makkah to perform worship according to the example of Prophet Muhammad ï·º. It can be performed throughout the year, unlike Hajj which has a specific time.
intro.hadith: Umrah to Umrah is an expiation for sins committed between them

steps.description: Prepare yourself before departure, both physically and spiritually
details: Apply perfume (for men only, before wearing Ihram)
steps.tips: Prepare before leaving home or before reaching the Miqat

steps.description: Wear Ihram garments and make intention at the Miqat

details: Men: Shave the head completely (better) or trim hair all over the head

steps.tips: The Prophet ï·º made dua for those who shave 3 times, and for those who trim once

steps.description: Alhamdulillah, Umrah is complete!

intro.title: Welcome to the Salah Journey
intro.description: Salah is the second pillar of Islam, the connection between a servant and Allah. Every Muslim who has reached puberty must pray 5 times daily.
intro.hadith: The first thing a servant will be questioned about on the Day of Judgment is prayer

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: Prepare before prayer
details: Wear clean clothes covering the awrah
steps.tips: Men's awrah: navel to knees | Women's awrah: entire body except face and hands

steps.title: Wudu (Ablution)
steps.description: Perform wudu completely
details: 7. Wash arms to elbows 3 times (start right)
10. Wash feet to ankles 3 times (start right)

dua.meaning: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah alone, with no partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and messenger

steps.tips: Recite dua after completing wudu, all 8 gates of Paradise will open for you to choose

steps.title: Niyyah (Intention)
steps.description: Make intention in the heart for prayer
details: Intend in your heart which prayer you will perform
Whether as imam, follower, or praying alone
Intention is in the heart, no need to verbalize
steps.tips: Niyyah is the intention in the heart, it doesn't need to be spoken

steps.title: Takbiratul Ihram
steps.description: Raise hands and say takbir
details: Raise hands to ear level (or shoulder level)
Place right hand over left on chest
steps.tips: Takbiratul Ihram is a pillar (rukn). Without it, prayer is invalid

hajj.title: Hajj Journey
hajj.description: Learn every step of performing Hajj in the holy city of Makkah

intro.title: Welcome to the Hajj Journey
intro.description: Hajj is the fifth pillar of Islam, obligatory for every Muslim who is capable, at least once in their lifetime. A sacred journey to Baytullah.
intro.hadith: Whoever performs Hajj for Allah and does not speak obscenely or commit sins, he will return like the day his mother gave birth to him

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: Prepare physically and spiritually before departure
details: Pay off debts and seek forgiveness from others
Prepare halal funds for the journey
Study and understand the Hajj rituals
steps.tips: An accepted Hajj (Hajj Mabrur) has no reward other than Paradise

steps.title: Wearing Ihram
steps.description: Wear Ihram garments and make intention at the Miqat
details: Take a bath and cleanse yourself
Men: Wear two white unsewn cloths

dua.arabic: Ù„ÙØ¨ÙÙ‘ÙŠÙ’ÙƒÙ Ø§Ù„Ù„ÙÙ‘Ù‡ÙÙ…ÙÙ‘ Ø­ÙØ¬Ù‹Ù‘Ø§
dua.meaning: Here I am O Allah, for Hajj

steps.tips: There are 3 types: Tamattu' (Umrah then Hajj), Qiran (Umrah and Hajj together), Ifrad (Hajj only)

steps.title: Tawaf al-Qudum
steps.description: Arrival Tawaf around the Kaaba (for those coming from outside Makkah)
details: Sunnah for those traveling from outside Makkah

dua.arabic: Ø¨ÙØ³Ù’Ù…Ù Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ÙØŒ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡Ù Ø£ÙÙƒÙ’Ø¨ÙØ±
dua.meaning: In the name of Allah, Allah is the Greatest

steps.tips: Tawaf al-Qudum is Sunnah, not obligatory

steps.title: 8th Dhul Hijjah - Going to Mina
steps.description: Depart for Mina on the Day of Tarwiyah
details: Wear Ihram and make intention for Hajj (if doing Tamattu')
Pray Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha, and Fajr in Mina
Spend time in dhikr and dua
steps.tips: This day is called 'Day of Tarwiyah' because people would prepare water

steps.title: 9th - Standing at Arafah
steps.description: Stand at the Plain of Arafah - The heart of Hajj
details: Pray Dhuhr and Asr combined and shortened at Arafah
Raise hands and make abundant dua
No need to climb the mountain, anywhere in Arafah is valid

dua.arabic: Ù„ÙØ§ Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ°Ù‡Ù Ø¥ÙÙ„ÙÙ‘Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡Ù ÙˆÙØ­Ù’Ø¯ÙÙ‡Ù Ù„ÙØ§ Ø´ÙØ±ÙÙŠÙƒÙ Ù„ÙÙ‡ØŒ Ù„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙÙ„Ù’ÙƒÙ ÙˆÙÙ„ÙÙ‡Ù Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙÙ…Ù’Ø¯ØŒ ÙˆÙÙ‡ÙÙˆÙ Ø¹ÙÙ„ÙÙ‰Ù° ÙƒÙÙ„ÙÙ‘ Ø´ÙÙŠÙ’Ø¡Ù Ù‚ÙØ¯ÙÙŠØ±
dua.transliteration: La ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamd, wa huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir
dua.meaning: There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He has power over all things

steps.tips: The Prophet ï·º said: Hajj is Arafah - Missing this day invalidates your Hajj

steps.title: Staying at Muzdalifah
steps.description: Travel to Muzdalifah after sunset
details: Pray Maghrib and Isha combined and shortened at Muzdalifah
Collect 7 or more small pebbles for stoning at Mina
steps.tips: Women, elderly, and weak people are allowed to leave Muzdalifah after midnight

steps.title: 10th - Day of Eid al-Adha
steps.description: Day of Sacrifice - The busiest day
details: Sacrifice an animal (for Tamattu' and Qiran)
Exit partial state of Ihram (Tahallul Asghar)
Perform Sa'i (if doing Tamattu' or haven't done it yet)

steps.tips: Best order: Stoning > Sacrifice > Shaving > Tawaf, but order can be changed

steps.title: Days of Tashreeq (11-13 Dhul Hijjah)
steps.description: Stay at Mina and stone the 3 pillars
details: First pillar (Sughra): 7 pebbles, then stop for dua
Second pillar (Wusta): 7 pebbles, then stop for dua
Allowed to leave on 12th before Maghrib (Ta'ajjul)
steps.tips: If leaving on 12th, must leave before sunset, otherwise must stay and stone on 13th

steps.title: Farewell Tawaf
steps.description: Circumambulate the Kaaba as farewell before leaving Makkah
details: Make dua before leaving the mosque
Should be the last thing done in Makkah

dua.meaning: O Allah, this House is Your House, the Sacred Precinct is Your Sacred Precinct, the security is Your security, and this is the place of the one seeking Your protection from the Fire

steps.tips: Women in menstruation are exempted from Farewell Tawaf

steps.title: Hajj Completed
steps.description: Alhamdulillah, Hajj is complete!
details: Hope for an accepted Hajj (Hajj Mabrur)
Maintain the goodness gained from Hajj
Return home with a purified heart

steps.tips: Hajj Mabrur has no reward other than Paradise

completed.message: You have learned all the steps of Hajj
completed.dua: May Allah grant you the opportunity to perform Hajj at Baytullah. Ameen

sawm.title: Fasting Journey
sawm.description: Learn how to fast correctly during Ramadan

intro.title: Welcome to the Fasting Journey
intro.description: Fasting during Ramadan is the fourth pillar of Islam. It involves abstaining from food, drink, and other invalidators from dawn until sunset.
intro.hadith: Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and seeking reward, his past sins will be forgiven

steps.title: Preparing for Ramadan
steps.description: Prepare physically and spiritually to welcome Ramadan
details: Make up any missed fasts from previous year

steps.tips: The Prophet ï·º used to fast a lot in Sha'ban to prepare for Ramadan

steps.title: Making Intention
steps.description: Make intention to fast before dawn
details: Intend in your heart to fast the next day
Must intend before dawn (for obligatory fasts)
Intention is in the heart, no need to verbalize
One intention at the beginning of the month suffices for the whole month
steps.tips: Waking up for Suhoor is considered an intention to fast

steps.title: Eating Suhoor
steps.description: Pre-dawn meal before beginning the fast
details: Wake up to eat before dawn
Eating Suhoor is a blessed Sunnah
Delay Suhoor close to Imsak (stop eating time)
Stop eating when hearing the Fajr Adhan

dua.transliteration: Nawaytu sawma ghadin 'an ada'i fardi shahri Ramadana hadhihis-sanati lillahi ta'ala
dua.meaning: I intend to fast tomorrow to fulfill the obligation of Ramadan this year for Allah the Most High

steps.tips: The Prophet ï·º said: Eat Suhoor, for there is blessing in Suhoor

steps.title: Fasting During the Day
steps.description: Abstain from invalidators from dawn to sunset
details: Abstain from all food and drink
Guard your tongue from bad speech
Control your emotions, don't get angry
steps.tips: If someone insults or argues with you, say 'I am fasting'

steps.title: What Breaks the Fast
steps.description: Know what invalidates your fast
details: Nutritional injections that enter the body
steps.tips: If you eat or drink forgetfully, the fast is still valid. Stop immediately and continue fasting

steps.title: What Doesn't Break the Fast
steps.description: Know what is permissible while fasting
details: Bathing and swimming (be careful of water entering mouth)
steps.tips: The Prophet ï·º used miswak while fasting

steps.title: Breaking the Fast (Iftar)
steps.description: Eating when the sun sets
details: Break fast immediately when hearing Maghrib Adhan
Make dua while breaking fast (duas are accepted)

dua.transliteration: Dhahaba adh-dhama'u wabtallatil-'uruqu wa thabatal-ajru insha'Allah
dua.meaning: The thirst has gone, the veins are moistened, and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills

steps.tips: The Prophet ï·º said: People will remain in goodness as long as they hasten to break their fast

steps.title: Taraweeh Prayer
steps.description: Special Sunnah prayer during Ramadan nights
details: Praying in congregation at the mosque has great reward
Try to pray every night throughout the month
steps.tips: Whoever stands in prayer during Ramadan nights with faith and seeking reward, his past sins will be forgiven

steps.title: Seeking Laylatul Qadr
steps.description: The Night better than a thousand months
details: In the odd nights of the last 10 nights
Increase worship in the last 10 nights
Perform I'tikaf in the mosque (if possible)
Make abundant dua, especially this one

dua.meaning: O Allah, You are Forgiving and love forgiveness, so forgive me

steps.tips: Aisha asked the Prophet ï·º what dua to make on Laylatul Qadr, and he taught her this dua

steps.title: Zakat al-Fitr
steps.description: Pay Zakat to purify before Eid
details: Pay for yourself and those under your care
Amount: 1 Sa' (about 2.5-3 kg) of staple food
Can pay as money according to some scholars
steps.tips: Zakat al-Fitr purifies the fast from idle talk and provides food for the poor on Eid day

steps.title: Eid al-Fitr
steps.description: Celebration day after Ramadan
details: Take a bath and dress nicely
Eat something before going to prayer
Say Takbeer on the way to the mosque

dua.meaning: May Allah accept from us and from you

completed.title: Congratulations!
completed.message: You have learned all the steps of fasting in Ramadan
completed.dua: May Allah let us reach Ramadan and accept our fasting. Ameen
